title: Priestly Duties and Provisions
shortSummary: Numbers 18 outlines the responsibilities and privileges of Aaron and his sons as priests, as well as the role of the Levites in serving the tabernacle. The chapter establishes the sacredness of their service, the allocation of offerings, and the provision of tithes as their inheritance, emphasizing God's provision and holiness in worship.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Wilderness Journey after the Exodus

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: The first high priest of Israel, charged with bearing the iniquity of the sanctuary and overseeing the priestly duties.

keyCharacters.name: Sons of Aaron
keyCharacters.description: Aaron's descendants who share in the priestly office and responsibilities in the tabernacle service.

keyCharacters.name: Levites
keyCharacters.description: Members of the tribe of Levi who assist the priests by ministering in the tabernacle but do not perform the priestly functions themselves.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who receives God's instructions and communicates them to the people and the Levites.

definitions.definition: A portion of an offering lifted up or dedicated to the Lord, often given to the priests as their portion.
One-tenth of the produce or income given as an offering to God, designated here as the inheritance of the Levites.
The holy place where God’s presence dwells, including the tabernacle and its sacred furnishings.
To buy back or set free, often referring to the ritual payment to reclaim the firstborn or certain offerings.

outline.heading: Priestly Responsibility and Levite Service
outline.description: God assigns Aaron and his sons the responsibility to bear the iniquity of the sanctuary and perform priestly duties, while the Levites are appointed to assist but must not approach the holy vessels to avoid death.

outline.heading: Priestly Portion of Offerings
outline.description: God grants Aaron and his sons the heave offerings, firstfruits, and other holy gifts as their perpetual inheritance, emphasizing the sacredness and provision for the priesthood.

outline.heading: Inheritance of the Priests and Levites
outline.description: Aaron is told he will have no land inheritance among Israel, but God Himself is his portion; the Levites receive the tithes of Israel as their inheritance for their service.

outline.heading: Tithes and Heave Offerings from the Levites
outline.description: Instructions are given for the Levites to offer a tenth of their tithes as a heave offering to the priests, ensuring the continual provision for the priestly family and maintaining holiness in the offerings.

application: Recognize the importance of obedience to God's appointed roles and respect for His holy service in the church today.
Trust in God's provision for those who faithfully serve Him, as He promises to supply their needs through His appointed means.
Honor the sacredness of worship by approaching God with reverence and purity, avoiding casual or irreverent attitudes toward holy things.
Give faithfully and sacrificially, understanding that tithes and offerings support the work of ministry and the spread of the gospel.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD spake unto Aaron, Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any part among them: I am thy part and thine inheritance among the children of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's promise to be the true inheritance of the priests, emphasizing reliance on Him rather than earthly possessions.

keyVerses.text: And, behold, I have given the children of Levi all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their service which they serve, even the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.
keyVerses.significance: It establishes the tithe as the Levites’ inheritance, linking faithful service to God’s provision.

keyVerses.text: Therefore thou and thy sons with thee shall keep your priest's office for every thing of the altar, and within the vail; and ye shall serve: I have given your priest's office unto you as a service of gift: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the sacredness and exclusivity of the priestly office, warning against unauthorized approach to holy duties.

keyVerses.text: Thus speak unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shall offer up an heave offering of it for the LORD, even a tenth part of the tithe.
keyVerses.significance: It teaches the principle of giving a portion back to God from what He has provided, exemplifying stewardship and worship.
